column1: Little Goat Diner////Right next to me there was the much recommended "This Little Piggy Went to China" featuring Szechuan Pork Sausage
column2: which was very well garnished but essentially the same size as a McDonald's breakfast biscuit. On the other end of the spectrum
column3: there is the Los Drowned (braised beef) and The Fat Club (turkey)
column4: which were both so huge that they had to take the other half to go. All that disparity was found in items that are only separated by a $1 difference in price
